net.cloud.server.entity.player.save

Class PlayerLoadHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.entity.player.save.PlayerLoadHandler

  • public class PlayerLoadHandler
extends Object
    A class to handle loading a player's data from file storage. Handles the extra complexity of loading from a file, as compared to just deserializing.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Player player
      The player whose data we are going to be loading

    • Constructor Summary

        private final Player player
        The player whose data we are going to be loading

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerLoadHandler

        public PlayerLoadHandler(Player player)
        Create a new handler object for the given player. This is really only needed for loading, and it could probably be static... but whatever. It's more similar to the save handler this way.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose data is going to be loaded

    • Method Detail

      • deserialize

        public void deserialize(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
                 throws BufferableException
        Restore a player's data. This is not for loading from a file. Instead, it's an optional route to player.restore(buffer). Of course, rather than create this just for that, just call the method in player.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer the data is in
        Throws:
        BufferableException - If the player's data could not be restored

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile()
                  throws PlayerLoadException
        Load a player's data from the save file. This does not validate the player's credentials. Instead, it will take an existing player object and have the rest of the information restored to the save state. This only needs to be done once near the end of login. It will also tell the player that it has been loaded, so that it will be ready for saving.
        All of the work is done on the calling thread, so this does not return until the player has been completely and successfully loaded. If something goes wrong, an exception will be thrown.
        Throws:
        PlayerLoadException - If the player data could not be restored for some reason

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile(RandomAccessFile dataFile)
                  throws PlayerLoadException
        Load a player's data from the provided save file. This does not validate the player's credentials. Instead, it will take an existing player object and have the rest of the information restored to the save state. This only needs to be done once near the end of login. It will also tell the player that it has been loaded, so that it will be ready for saving.
        All of the work is done on the calling thread, so this does not return until the player has been completely and successfully loaded. If something goes wrong, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - An open file to read player save data from
        Throws:
        PlayerLoadException - If the player data could not be restored for some reason

      • loadUserAndPass

        public void loadUserAndPass(String username)
                     throws PlayerLoadException,
                            IOException
        The player this handler is created for will have its username and password set from the data in the data file for the player with the given username. Only the username and password are set. If there is no such player save matching the username, then an IO exception is thrown immediately - no file is opened and nothing is read. Regardless of the exception, assume it is unsafe to proceed. It is unknown whether the username and/or/neither password have actually been set.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the player
        Throws:
        PlayerLoadException - Save file could not be found
        IOException - Save file did not exist, could not be read from, or could not be closed

      • loadUserAndPass

        public void loadUserAndPass(RandomAccessFile dataFile)
                     throws IOException
        The player this handler is created for will have its username and password set from the data in the file. This assumes the file has just been opened and the pointer is at the beginning.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - The player data
        Throws:
        IOException - If the file could not be read

      • saveFileExists

        private boolean saveFileExists(String username)
        Check to see if there is a save file matching the given username
        Parameters:
        username - The player data to look for
        Returns:
        True if there is a save file

      • getSaveFile

        private RandomAccessFile getSaveFile(String username)
                              throws PlayerLoadException
        Obtain a RAF from the File Server for the player's save data. Waits until the request has been served.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the player
        Returns:
        A RAF from the File Server for the player's save data
        Throws:
        PlayerLoadException - If the request could not be served

      • getFileBytes

        private byte[] getFileBytes(Player player,
                            RandomAccessFile dataFile)
                     throws PlayerLoadException
        Obtain a byte array with the contents of the file
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose file we're looking into
        dataFile - The file to read the player data from
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the data from the file
        Throws:
        PlayerLoadException - If the file could not be read

      • restorePlayerData

        private void restorePlayerData(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf nettyBuffer)
                        throws PlayerLoadException
        Deserialize the player data. Happens on the calling thread. Afterwards the given player object will have its data restored to reflect the data contained in the buffer.
        Parameters:
        nettyBuffer - The buffer with the player object data
        Throws:
        PlayerLoadException - If the data could not be deserialized
